danish_publication: Der skal en gang have været rövere i Rørbæk skov i Vester sogn. Der siges, at de havde en snor spændt over vejen, som gik gjennem skoven. Når nogen rørte ved den, ringede en klokke nede i deres hule, hvorpå de foer op og overfaldt den vejfarende. En gang kom en mand med kone og börn kjørende ad vejen, det mærkede röverne, overfaldt dem og slog dem ihjel på et lille barn nær, som de ikke nænnede at dræbe. Men lidt efter kom en fraværende röver, der hed Jörgen, hjem. Da han så barnet, sagde han: "Hvad er det for en unge, ham skal jeg snart negle!" hvorpå han tog barnet og slog det ihjel. Siden den tid kaldte de andre rövere ham altid Jörgen Negl.
english_publication: There was supposed to have been robbers in Rørbæk forest in Vester parish. It is said that they had a rope tied across the road that went through the forest. When somebody touched it, a bell rang down in their den, at which point they’d fly up and attack the traveler. One time a man came driving down the road with his wife and children. The robbers noticed this, so they attacked them and killed them all except for the little child, whom they didn't have the heart to kill. But a little bit later a robber, who had been away, and who was called Jørgen, came home. When he saw the child he said: “What’s this youngster; I’ll soon nick him!” at which point he grabbed the child and killed it. After that time, all the other robbers called him “Jørgen Nick.”
